attributes.action: Stop British Passports being made in France post Brexit
attributes.additional_details: De la Rue currently make British Passports in Gateshead, a British company employing people from the north east. This Government has decided that after Brexits the contract should go to a Dutch/French company in France. France meanwhile don’t obey EU rules re competition stating that French Passports must be made in France for security reasons.
attributes.background: The Government are about to rubber stamp a 10 year deal that will see  post Brexit Passports being made in France, putting jobs at risk in Gateshead where they are currently made. Please sign to stop this ludicrous decision
